docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text: We are using uv to manage our python dependencies in this project. To get started with uv, following their setup guide.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text: We are using mkdocs to build the documentation site.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: A Visual Walkthrough
docs.text:
Idox make the planning portal for software uses by most local planning authorities in the UK.

This is what the main search form of an Idox planning portal looks like:

docs.title: The Advanced Search Form
docs.text:
If we click over to the "Advanced" tab, this is what we see:

The URL of the advanced search tab is, in the case of Cambridge:

https://applications.greatercambridgeplanning.org/online-applications/search.do?action=advanced

This is the scraper's start URL.

docs.title: The Advanced Search Form's Results Page
docs.text: If we leave the applications button selected, and enter a start and end value for the "Date Validated" field, we get a list of results that looks something like this:

docs.title: An Application
docs.text: If we click on one of those applications, (not on pictured in this case), we get taken to the application's "Details > Summary" tab:

docs.title: Information
docs.text:
• Reference
  • Application Received
  • Application Validated
  • Address
  • Proposal
  • Status
  • Decision
  • Decision Issued Date
  • Appeal Status
  • Appeal Decision

docs.title: Information
docs.text:
• Application Type
  • Decision
  • Expected Decision Level
  • Case Officer
  • Parish
  • Ward
  • District Reference
  • Applicant Name
  • Agent Name
  • Agent Company Name
  • Agent Address
  • Environmental Assessment

docs.title: Information
docs.text:
For each document, we get:

  • Date Published
  • Document Type
  • Measure
  • Drawing Number
  • Description
